Mini 1749: Classic Rock Mafia

Welcome to the studio!

Rules in the studio:
1) All decisions come down to a democracy. The moderator gets 14 votes.
2) Please use vote tags to place your votes. Bold tags will not be counted.
3) Lynches will occur when one player has received the majority of votes. You may post during the twilight period between the hammer and the closing of the thread.
4) If unsufficient votes are made on any player, or a majority of votes have been made to no lynch, no lynch will be made.
5) Nights will last 48 hours.
6) Do NOT quote any private communication from me, nor any mason, scum, neighbour, or house party topics that may or may not exist. You may paraphrase, just don't copy it wholesale.
7) You MAY NOT discuss the game outside of the thread unless your role specifically gives you the ability to do so.
8) Days will last 2 weeks, or until a lynch (or no lynch) has been decided on.
9) Blue is my color. Refrain from using it.
10) Inform the mod before going V/LA. I will prod you after 48 hours of inactivity, and then again after 24 hours. At that point, I will be forced to replace you.
11) In the tragic event I drop off the face of the earth, a backup moderator will take my place.
12) In the event a deadline is reached, it will become a no lynch by default.
13) Death is final, but a single contentless "bah!" post will be permitted.
14) The rules can be arbitrarily changed/added to by one party (me) anytime I am feeling greedy and/or evil.
15) Be nice, and try to enjoy yourself.

Failure to abide by these rules is punishable by hours and hours of forced Justin Bieber listening.

This setup uses daytalk.

Example PM:

You are a Vanilla Townie.
You are aligned with the Town.
Your only tool is your vote.
You win when all anti-town factions are dead and there is at least one town alive.

But the lynches give us information about who voted, when they voted, whether they were opportunistic or jumped off the wagon at the last moment, whether they were pointing a FoS at someone but not voting etc. This is why day one lynches are useful even though we are more likely to kill town. Vigilante kills only give us information from the flip. This is why they are anti-town.

A vigilante should avoid using their ability until they are confident of hitting scum.

Have you ever watched a hockey game? Players skate around a rink and try to shoot a puck in the opposing net that is guarded by a goalie.

The game is won after three periods by the team with the most goals.

In recent years, analysts have been studying "advanced statistics". In other words, collecting information. Possession, shots for, shots against, faceoff wins, controlled zone entries.

The theory is that if a team shoots the puck more than gets shot at, possesses the puck longer, wins more faceoffs, and enters the opposing team's side of the ice with the puck more often, they will come out ahead. But those don't always translate directly to goals. One netminder can singlehandedly change the entire game's outcome by a combination of luck and skill. So while the coaches do pay attention to all the aforementioned "advanced stats" to develop their strategy, the players themselves have to focus on "high scoring chances". Shots taken in the slot, the zone directly in front of the net, have higher impact than shots taken from the periphery, or from the neutral zone, for example.

All this to say that the vig should always shoot whether he's confident or not because no matter what the structure of the coach is, high scoring chances must be capitalized upon.

The greatest hockey player to ever skate, Wayne Gretzky, famously said "you miss 100% of the shots you don't take". My point is the vig is a very pro-town role and should be given free reign to shoot for us to get better odds of winning. I'm going to bed now. Good night.

I know that you can't help it, but it is important to remember that it is just a game. We play it for fun. When someone accuses you of being scum (and it can be annoying for sure!), then it has nothing to do with you personally, but just how you play the game. We are fallible. We all make mistakes. Even when you know that we are wrong, we might not know it. We play to win. Take it lightly. It is supposed to be fun!

As scum, I frame people. I use everything I can against them (of course, not literally everything), but sometimes it causes people to respond in an intensive manner. I might buddy you for a few days and then lynch you anyway when it becomes convenient for me. Some people would perceive that as betrayal (and take it personal), but it is part of the game.

As town, I try my best to lynch scum. I can be wrong, but sometimes I have to act like I cannot be wrong; that I somehow know that someone is scum for sure. This might be perceived as mean or unjust if you are actually town and forget that it is just a game. But I don't know everything. I have to make guesses all the time, maximize the probability of winning.

In the end, it doesn't matter who wins, or what I am. I like most of you people here, including you. I have yet to meet someone on this forum that I truly dislike personally.
